intro: Hoffmannia arborescens, commonly known as the tree hoffmannia, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. Hoffmannia arborescens is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
